newsitem.title: ITALY: TABLE - Italy has non-EU trade surplus in May.
newsitem.headline: TABLE - Italy has non-EU trade surplus in May.

text.p: Italy had a 4.534 trillion lire trade surplus with non-European Union countries in May, the national statistics office ISTAT said.
ITALY TRADE BALANCE (NON-EU) May 97 April 97 May 96
Cumulative yr to date +15.145 trln +10.611 trln r +14.381 trln Imports yr to date 56.613 trln 45.011 trln r 55.634 trln
Exports yr to date 71.758 trln 55.622 trln r 70.015 trln
Istat gave the following breakdown for the trade balance with European Union countries for April.
Cumulative yr to date +3.176 trln +2.719 trln r +4.377 trln
Note -- Istat said that Italy had a global trade surplus in April of 4.084 trillion lire against a surplus of 4.458 trillion lire in the same month last year.
-- In the first four months of 1997 Italy had a global trade surplus of 13.786 trillion lire.
-- The 'r' after a figure denotes revised number.
